meanings.definition: To overlap or lie over each other.
meanings.sent1: The two pieces of fabric interlaps on the table.
meanings.sent2: The shingles on the roof interlaps to keep the rain out.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces interlaps perfectly, creating a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the trees interlaps, forming a natural canopy above.
meanings.sent5: The dancers' movements interlaps seamlessly, creating a mesmerizing performance.

meanings.sent1: The threads interlaps to create a strong fabric.
meanings.sent2: The fingers of the two lovers interlaps as they walk together.
meanings.sent3: The vines in the garden interlaps in a playful dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The stories of the characters interlaps, revealing unexpected connections.
meanings.sent5: The melodies of the instruments interlaps harmoniously, filling the room with music.

meanings.sent1: The roads interlaps at the town square.
meanings.sent2: The hiking trails interlaps in the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The timelines of history interlaps in a fascinating way.
meanings.sent4: The interests of the group interlaps, leading to lively discussions.
meanings.sent5: The lives of the characters interlaps at a crucial moment, changing their fates.
